title: What is the birth date of Queen Cleopatra? - Quora

response.answer_text: We will never know. For all the sensationalized novels are books produced about Cleopatra, we actually know very little about her through rigorous historical evidence. Following is an order signed by Cleopatra. ‘ginesthoi’ (Make it happen) Cleopatra scribbled at the end. Today that piece of handwriting is about the only thing which we can definitively link to Cleopatra.  [Source] Her biography was written 200 years after her death by Plutarch. There are no known contemporary accounts of Cleopatra, who’s actually Cleopatra (VII). Exact identity of her mother is not known for sure as well. Most experts think Cleopatra (V) gave birth to Cleopatra(VII). The consensus is that the year of birth was 69 BC. Of course, by the time of her death she was prominent part of power struggles in the Roman empire. Her death along with Marc Antony was a big ‘hoorray!’ moment for Augustus so it was carefully and meticulously recorded by his scribes. She died on August 12, 30 BC

She is usually dated to 69 BC, but there is no recorded birthday for her that in aware of. The Egyptian calendar did not sync up that perfectly with the roman one -- and the Roman one before it was reformed by Cleopatra's future boyfriend Julius Caesar wasn't particularly reliable either so you could take that plus or minus a year.
